Package mbsgui

Class FishDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kzoo.grid.display.ScaledDisplay
      • mbsgui.FishDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.kzoo.grid.display.GridObjectDisplay
    public class FishDisplay
extends edu.kzoo.grid.display.ScaledDisplay
    Grid-Based Marine Biology Simulation Program:
    The FishDisplay class provides a way to display a fish using an image, rotating and tinting it as needed.
    Version:
    25 April 2019
    Author:
    Julie Zelensk (2002), Chris Nevison (2002), Alyce Brady (2002, 2019)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FishDisplay()
      Constructs an object that knows how to draw a simple fish (which will need to be rotated when displayed).

      • buildPaths

        protected void buildPaths()
        Sets up the paths used for the fish with default values for the body, tail, and eyes.

      • buildPaths

        protected void buildPaths​(double bodyWidth,
                          double bodyLength,
                          double tailWidth,
                          double tailLength,
                          double eyeSize)
        Sets up the paths used for the fish body, tail, and eyes. Different parameters will change the proportions, and thereby control the "look" of the fish. The various parameters should be specified assuming the fish will occupy a cell of size (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        bodyWidth - width of the elliptical body
        bodyLength - length of the elliptical body
        tailWidth - width of the triangular tail
        tailLength - length of the triangular tail
        eyeSize - diameter of the eye

      • draw

        public void draw​(edu.kzoo.grid.GridObject objToDraw,
                 java.awt.Component comp,
                 java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Draws the given object as a fish. Fills a simple fish with gradient paint using the paths created in the construtor. The Fish is drawn facing North in a cell of size (1,1) centered around (0,0) on the drawing surface. (All scaling/rotating has been done beforehand).
        Specified by:
        draw in class edu.kzoo.grid.display.ScaledDisplay
        Parameters:
        objToDraw - object we want to draw to look like a fish
        comp - component on which to draw
        g2 - drawing surface

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor​(edu.kzoo.grid.GridObject objToDraw)
